newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks seen returning to upward swing.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks seen returning to upward swing.

text.p: Caracas shares were seen returning to their upward swing after Thursday's session saw prices blip lower on profit-taking, traders said.
"It could well be another busy day," said Multinvest broker Mario Simosa, adding he saw prices stable to rising.
On Thursday, the market's 19-share index lost 0.76 percent to close at 4,575.33 as 11.36 million shares traded worth 1.7 billion bolivars ($3.6 million).
Among traded issues 21 fell, nine rose and eleven closed flat.
